organization.fullName: The George Institute for Global Health, China

identificationModule.briefTitle: Intensive Ambulance-delivered Blood Pressure Reduction in Hyper-Acute Stroke Trial
identificationModule.officialTitle: Intensive Ambulance-delivered Blood Pressure Reduction in Hyper-Acute Stroke Trial

responsibleParty.investigatorAffiliation: The George Institute for Global Health, China

leadSponsor.name: The George Institute for Global Health, China

collaborators.name: First Affiliated Hospital of Chengdu Medical College, China
Sichuan Academy of Medical Sciences & Sichuan Provincial People's Hospital, China

descriptionModule.briefSummary: A multicentre, ambulance-delivered, prospective, randomized, open-label, blinded endpoint (PROBE) study to assess the effects of hyperacute intensive blood pressure (BP) lowering initiated in ambulance setting on (i) functional outcome in patients with acute stroke (ii) safety in patients with confirmed acute stroke and other conditions that were initially suspected as acute stroke (i.e. stroke mimic).
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: As an investigator initiated and conducted, multicentre, ambulance-delivered, prospective, randomised, open-label, blinded outcome (PROBE) study. INTERACT4 aims to evaluate the effects of functional outcome according to an ordinal analysis of the full range of scores on the mRS, the safety in all randomised patients; reperfusion treatment (thrombolysis and/or thrombectomy) related symptomatic ICH (sICH, according to standard definitions), infarct size, the time to and overall rate of reperfusion treatment in AIS patients; hematoma volume and early expansion in ICH.

maskingInfo.maskingDescription: Outcome assessor is independent of the treatment team

armGroups.label: Intervention group
armGroups.description: If systolic blood pressure\>180:IV Urapidil 25mg If systolic blood pressure\>150 (or 5 mins after first bolus) : IV Urapidil 25mg and to maintain this level after admission to hospital in those with confirmed acute stroke for the next 7 days (or hospital discharge if earlier)

armGroups.label: control group
armGroups.description: To receive blood pressure management according to standard local guidelines which recommend blood pressure lowering in hospital if systolic level is \>220mmHg. This level will be considered by ambulance staff as a threshold for treatment if considered clinically important.

interventions.name: urapidil
interventions.description: A standard treatment regime based on intravenous (IV) bolus of 25mg urapidil administered over 1 minute. For those patients initial systolic blood pressure 180, another 25mg urapidil bolus will be given if the systolic blood pressure level persists \>150 after 5 minutes.

primaryOutcomes.description: Level of function defined across 7 categories of disability on the modified Rankin scale （mRS 0-6) in which scores of 0 or 1 indicate good function without or with symptoms but not disability, socress of 2 indicates slight disability but independence, 3 to 5 indicate increasing levels of disability (and dependency), and a score of 6 indicates death.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: number of patients with serious adverse events
secondaryOutcomes.description: total number of serious adverse events reported during follow-up, according to standard definitions

secondaryOutcomes.measure: number of patients with any intracranial hemorrhage
secondaryOutcomes.description: reperfusion treatment (thrombolysis/thrombectomy) related symptomatic intracerebral number of cases of intracranial hemorrhage, according to standard definitions
overall size of cerebral infarction on MRI within 2 days in cases of ischaemic stroke

secondaryOutcomes.measure: number of patients who receive reperfusion treatment
secondaryOutcomes.description: total number of cases of reperfusion (thrombolysis and/or thrombectomy) in ischemic stroke

secondaryOutcomes.measure: time to use of reperfusion treatment
secondaryOutcomes.description: time from symptom onset to reperfusion treatment in patients with ischemic stroke
change in volume of hematoma from baseline to 24 hours, measured on brain imaging
volume of hematoma at baseline measured on brain imaging

Level of function defined across 7 categories of disability on the modified Rankin scale （mRS 0-6) in which scores of 0 or 1 indicate good function without or with symptoms but not disability, socress of 2 indicates slight disability but independence, 3 to 5 indicate increasing levels of disability (and dependency), and a score of 6 indicates death.

mRS(3-6)

Level of function defined across 7 categories of disability on the modified Rankin scale （mRS 0-6) in which scores of 0 or 1 indicate good function without or with symptoms but not disability, socress of 2 indicates slight disability but independence, 3 to 5 indicate increasing levels of disability (and dependency), and a score of 6 indicates death.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: death or dependency measured by a shift in NIHSS

references.citation: Song L, Chen C, Chen X, Guo Y, Liu F, Lin Y, Billot L, Li Q, Liu H, Si L, Ouyang M, Arima H, Bath PM, Ford GA, Robinson T, Sandset EC, Saver JL, Sprigg N, van der Worp HB, Zhang C, Yang J, Li G, Anderson CS; INTERACT4 investigators. INTEnsive ambulance-delivered blood pressure Reduction in hyper-ACute stroke Trial (INTERACT4): study protocol for a randomized controlled trial. Trials. 2021 Dec 6;22(1):885. doi: 10.1186/s13063-021-05860-y.

ipdSharingStatementModule.description: Data will be shared with bona fide researchers after 1 year following conclusion of the study, based on a submitted protocol to the research office of The George Institute for Global Health, Sydney Australia
ipdSharingStatementModule.timeFrame: 1 year after conclusion of the study
ipdSharingStatementModule.accessCriteria: genuine researcher with supporting institution protocol review and approval by the research office of The George Institute
